channel.title: Worlds
channel.description: Is there a way to put worlds on your server...so you can let more people play but with seperate worlds, like world 1, 2 and 3

item.title: Worlds
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Running more than one server from one computer is not possible, as your computer has only one IP number. What Jagex does is sets up different servers (Which are servers in the mechanical sense; they are like regular computers but designed with lots of power specifically for hard computing, like with 2000 people on a game at the same time) The servers are hosted by different network companies, they have the servers and let Jagex do with them what they please. When you log on, it sends a notice to the logon server that a new player is trying to log in, and the logon server loads the requested character profile, checks for corrent pass, makes sure the game server is online, and then if everything is good, lets the player connect to the game world.

Read full topic

item.title: Worlds
item.dc:creator: @Mrquarter Mrquarter
item.description:

Can u do from same comptuer, and is that what jagex does?

Read full topic

item.title: Worlds
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

You make a different server. In your case, that would mean get as many computers as you want worlds, link them together so they can update character profiles, load the same source onto them, and start the servers.

Read full topic

item.title: Worlds
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Each RuneScape world is a different server, they just all use the exact same source, and share character profiles.

Read full topic
